content: you can substitute fabric scraps or yarn scrap as stuffing if preferred turn down a 1cm hem at the body opening pin and ladder stitch the top of the body closed set aside now complete sewing the external frog body to complete the body align the frog body front to the for body back right sides together using mattress stitch neatly join the panels at the top and two sides leaving base open leave a tail of yarn turn through the body exterior slide the body exterior over the internal body it may be tight once completely covered ladder stitch the base of the body closed being neat as this is an exposed seam weave in ends frog legs internal using your leg panels for measurements cut two rectangles of stretch fabric adding about 2cm to length using the wadding cut two strips 2cm wide * the length of the frog leg panel long plus about 2 cm to form the first leg place 3 chenille sticks along one of the wadding strips using sewing needle and thread catch the wadding around the sticks in 4 or 5 places to form a wadding and chenille stick sausage lie the wadding and chenille sausage along one of the fabric strips and roll the fabric around the sausage like pastry use a pins to hold the fabric sausage roll closed temporarily then with sewing thread and needle whip stitch the top bottom and side seam closed repeat for second leg to form each leg lie one fabric sausage roll along one crochet leg panel pin the panel closed along the long side seam using yarn either mattress stitch or single_crochet closed the side seam repeat for second leg the fabric sausage roll should protrude a little at one end this end will be where the flippers are attached once the legs are joined to the frog body line both the legs up against the frog body base about 1 tile from each side have the leg seam facing inwards pin the legs to the body and then using yarn mattress stitch the legs to the base of the body to form the flippers line up one pair of flipper panels wrong sides together using the long tails left blanket stitch the flippers together leaving the ankle hole open repeat for a second pair of flippers align the flippers with the leg base over the stump of the fabric sausage roll pin and then using the yarn tails mattress stitch the leg ends to the flippers weave in ends arms the arms are formed in the same way as the legs with the following changes  use only one chenille stick and fold it in half for each arm  the arm will attach to the body on an angle to form shoulders line the shoulders up with the frog body side seam at a point below the mouth the frog body is now complete bend the legs at a point to form
